title: Istana Park
text:
The Istana Park is a <a href="park">park</a> in <a href="Singapore">Singapore</a>, located in the <a href="Museum%20Planning%20Area">Museum Planning Area</a> within the <a href="Central%20Area%2C%20Singapore">Central Area</a>, Singapore's <a href="central%20business%20district">central business district</a>. The park is bounded by <a href="Orchard%20Road">Orchard Road</a>, <a href="Penang%20Road">Penang Road</a>, Penang Lane and Buyong Road.
The park is a <a href="landmark">landmark</a> situated in front of the Presidential Residence, the <a href="Istana%2C%20Singapore">Istana</a>. It has an area of 13,000 square metres. The Istana Park serves as a gateway to Singapore's Civic District Trail, which aims to educate visitors of the rich <a href="history%20of%20Singapore">history of Singapore</a>.
History.
The Istana Park was completed in 1995. It was designed and built as an extension to the main entrance of the Istana. The park was officially opened on 6 September 1996 by National Development Minister Lim Hng Kiang. The Istana, located across the road, Orchard Road, from the park, is the official residence of the <a href="President%20of%20Singapore">President of Singapore</a>.
Highlights.
The centrepiece of the park is the 26-metre-high <a href="Festival">Festival</a> <a href="Arch">Arch</a> rising out of a shallow <a href="reflecting%20pool">reflecting pool</a>. The design of the <a href="stainless%20steel">stainless steel</a> and <a href="concrete">concrete</a> structure was inspired by the gateposts and <a href="Guard%20rail">railing</a>s at the Istana's entrance. The Festival Arch forms the gateway to Singapore's Civic District, the <a href="cultural">cultural</a> and historic heart of the city. The arch enhances the visual link across Orchard Road.
The park has a large shallow reflecting pool, the first of its kind in Singapore. <a href="Coconut">Coconut</a> palms at the adjoining Palm Pools reinforces the impression of the Istana Park as a tropical <a href="oasis">oasis</a> in the heart of Orchard Road.
Fronting the main gate of the Istana, the park provides a vantage point for visitors keen to view the monthly <a href="Guard%20Mounting%23Singapore">changing of guards’ ceremony</a> at the Istana entrance. In the evenings, the park is transformed into an "oasis of light". The park is one of the venues identified for enhanced lighting under the <a href="Urban%20Redevelopment%20Authority">Urban Redevelopment Authority</a>'s (URA) <a href="Lighting%20Master%20Plan">lighting master plan</a>.
<a href="Music">Music</a>al and cultural performances at the Istana Park are featured on the first Sunday of every month.
There is a restaurant called Giraffe Restaurant at Istana Park which is available to all for dining. Everyone can also participate/join in the concerts and performances held.
On 7 October 2017, the <a href="Istana%20Heritage%20Gallery">Istana Heritage Gallery</a>, located inside the park, was opened by President <a href="Tony%20Tan">Tony Tan</a>.
In popular culture.
Istana Park was served as the place for a U-Turn in the 9th Leg of the <a href="The%20Amazing%20Race%2016">sixteenth season</a> of "<a href="The%20Amazing%20Race%20%28American%20TV%20series%29">The Amazing Race</a>".
